sen.e: Sukekuni SO (1207? - November 4, 1274) was a busho (a Japanese military commander) who lived in the mid- Kamakura period.

sen.j: 『八幡愚童訓』によると、文永11年（1274年）の文永の役で、10月5日に対馬国府の八幡宮仮殿からおびただしい炎が上がり、人々が焼け失せるかと驚いたがそれは幻であった。
sen.e: "Hachiman Gudokun" (Exegesis of Hachimanshin [God of War] Legends for the Ignorant and Children) described an illusion in which Hachimangu sub-shrine in Tsushima Province bursted into flames engulfing many people on October 5, 1274.

"Hachiman Gudokun" (Exegesis of Hachimanshin [God of War] Legends for the Ignorant and Children) described that on November 11, 1274, in the Bunei War, Hachimangu sub-shrine in Tsushima Province bursted into flames, and people were frightened that it would be burned down, but it was an illusion.
sen.cmt: 「文永の役で」「驚いた｣が抜けていたので加えました。また、｢人々が」「驚いた」のであって、焼け失せたわけではないので、訳しなおしました。また、旧暦を新暦にしました。
sen.e: "Hachiman Gudokun" (Exegesis of Hachimanshin [God of War] Legends for the Ignorant and Children) described that on November 11, 1274, in the Bunei War, Hachimangu sub-shrine in Tsushima Province bursted into flames, and people were frightened that it would be burned down, but it was an illusion.

sen.j: その日の午後、対馬の西の海は一面に蒙古の軍船に覆われた。
sen.e: The Western sea of Tsushima was covered with Menggu battleships in the afternoon of that day.
The ｗestern sea of Tsushima was covered with Menggu battleships in the afternoon of that day.
sen.cmt: Westernのwを小文字にしました。
sen.e: The ｗestern sea of Tsushima was covered with Menggu battleships in the afternoon of that day.

sen.j: 午後4時頃、蒙古の船は対馬下島西岸の佐須浦（現対馬市厳原町小茂田浜）に接岸し、船450艘、3万人の軍勢が来襲した。
sen.e: Menggu battleships came alongside of the pier of Sasuura located at the western shore of Shimojima in Tsushima (presently known as Komodahama, Izuhara-cho, Tshima City) and about 30,000 troops from 450 ships raided the town at around 4:00 in the afternoon.

Mongolian battleships came alongside of the pier of Sasuura (present Komodahama, Izuhara-cho, Tshima City) located at the western shore of Shimojima in Tsushima and 450 ships, 30,000 troops raided the town at around four in the afternoon.
sen.cmt: 語順を変え、数字をスペルアウトしました。
sen.e: Mongolian battleships came alongside of the pier of Sasuura (present Komodahama, Izuhara-cho, Tshima City) located at the western shore of Shimojima in Tsushima and 450 ships, 30,000 troops raided the town at around four in the afternoon.

sen.j: 6時頃に国府の地頭所に連絡があり、対馬の地頭で守護少弐景資の代官でもある宗助国は、80余騎を率いて岩山の夜道を佐須浦へ馳せ向かった。
sen.e: Soon after the Jito (a landlord) office of Kokufu (a provincial capital) was informed about the raid at around 6:00 in the afternoon, Sukekuni SO, who was both the Jito of Tsushima province and the Daikan (a local governor) for Shugo (a military governor) Kagesuke SHONI, immediately left his office for Sasuura through rocky mountains with 80 followers in the dark.

When the Jito (a landlord) office of Kokufu (a provincial capital) was informed about the raid at around six in the afternoon, Sukekuni SO, who was both the Jito of Tsushima Province and the substitute of Shugo (a military governor), Kagesuke SHONI, left for Sasuura through rocky mountains in the dark, with more than 80 horse soldiers.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトし、provinceのPを大文字にし、代官は、守護代といういみなので、「代理」としました。Soon after をwhenとし、immediatelyを削除し、８０余騎を80 horse soldiersとしました。蒙古をMengguからMongolianにしました。
sen.e: When the Jito (a landlord) office of Kokufu (a provincial capital) was informed about the raid at around six in the afternoon, Sukekuni SO, who was both the Jito of Tsushima Province and the substitute of Shugo (a military governor), Kagesuke SHONI, left for Sasuura through rocky mountains in the dark, with more than 80 horse soldiers.

sen.j: 翌朝、通事（通訳）を使者として蒙古人に事情を尋ねたところ、蒙古軍は7、8艘の船から1千人ばかりが下り立ち、激しく矢を射かけて攻撃を始めた。
sen.e: The next morning, when a translator was sent to the Menggu line as an envoy by Sukekuni, to learn of the reason for the raid, Menggu answered with an intense attack of arrows shot by about one thousand troops unloaded from 7 or 8 ships.

The next morning, when a translator was sent to the Mongols as an envoy, asking for the reason of their raid, they answered with an intense attack of arrows shot by about one thousand troops unloaded from 7 to 8 ships.
sen.cmt: 事情を尋ねた部分を書き換えました。 Mengguをthe Mongols としました。
sen.e: The next morning, when a translator was sent to the Mongols as an envoy, asking for the reason of their raid, they answered with an intense attack of arrows shot by about one thousand troops unloaded from 7 to 8 ships.

sen.j: 助国らは急遽陣を立て直して応戦し、敵に痛手を与えたものの、多勢に無勢で2、3時間の激戦ののち、助国をはじめ子息の右馬次郎、養子の弥次郎、他に庄の太郎入道、肥後国の御家人田井藤三郎など全員が戦死した。
sen.e: Immediately after the attack by the Menggu line, Sukekuni rearranged his soldier's position to counter attack, causing some damage to the Menggu line; however, due to fighting between the small number of troops in the Sukekuni line and a large number of the Menggu line, all of the troops in the Sukekuni line including Sukekuni himself, his son, Umajiro, his adopted son, Yajiro, Sho no Taro-nyudo Monk, Tozaburo Tai, a Higo Province no Gokenin (Shogunal retainers) were killed.

Sukekuni immediately pulled his camp together for counter attack, which gave damage to the Mongols, however, it was outnumbered and after a couple of fierce battle, all the members of the Sukekuni camp, including Sukekuni himself, his son, Umajiro, his adopted son, Yajiro, Sho no Taro-nyudo Monk, Tozaburo Tai, and a Gokenin (Shogunal retainers) from Higo Province were killed.
sen.cmt: Mengguをthe Mongols としました。全体を簡潔に書き直しました。
sen.e: Sukekuni immediately pulled his camp together for counter attack, which gave damage to the Mongols, however, it was outnumbered and after a couple of fierce battle, all the members of the Sukekuni camp, including Sukekuni himself, his son, Umajiro, his adopted son, Yajiro, Sho no Taro-nyudo Monk, Tozaburo Tai, and a Gokenin (Shogunal retainers) from Higo Province were killed.

sen.j: 蒙古軍は佐須浦に火をかけて焼き払った。
sen.e: Menggu troops set fire to burn down Sasuura.
The Mongols set fire to Sasuura and it was burned down.

sen.e: The Mongols set fire to Sasuura and it was burned down.

sen.e: Two men named Kotaro and Hejiro hurriedly went to Hakata by boat and told a detailed account of what happened in Sasuura.

sen.j: 対馬市厳原町小茂田の小茂田浜神社に祭られている。
sen.e: Sukekuni and his followers are enshrined at Komodahama Shrine in Komoda, Izuhara-machi, Tsushima City.
Sukekuni and his followers are enshrined at Komodahama Shrine in Komoda, Izuhara-machi, Tsushima City.

sen.j: この神社では毎年11月12日の小茂田浜神社大祭において、鎧冑姿で練り歩き、海に向かって弓を放ち島の平和を祈願する「鳴弦の儀」が行われている。
sen.e: In this shrine, a ceremony, known as 'meigen no gi (a ceremony of resounding bowstrings), occurs every year on November 12th during the Komodahama Shrine Festival, in which people equipped with armor from head and toe parade around the town and shoot arrows towards the ocean to pray for peace in Tsushima island.

In this shrine, a ceremony, 'meigen no gi' (a ceremony of resounding bowstrings), in which people equipped with suit of armor parade around the town and shoot arrows towards the ocean to pray for peace for the island, is held every year on November 12, during the Komodahama Shrine Festival.
sen.cmt: 語順を入れ換え、「島の平和」の部分を書き換えました。
sen.e: In this shrine, a ceremony, 'meigen no gi' (a ceremony of resounding bowstrings), in which people equipped with suit of armor parade around the town and shoot arrows towards the ocean to pray for peace for the island, is held every year on November 12, during the Komodahama Shrine Festival.
